page.title: 02An introduction to Whitwell
page.content: Whitwell village was called Hwitan wyles great in 942 a.d.It is an ancient agricultural village mentioned in the{Domesday Book}and later part of the Duke of Portland's Welbeck estate.It gets its name from a tributory of Millwood Brook and a passage between the hills.Within the parish are two main ways of life,the old agriculture and the newer mining. The colliery was started in 1890, and the population of the village has risen steadily from 2,000 in 1881 to 4,603 in 1981. The number of houses in Whitwell has probably doubled in fifty years due to birth-rate figures.The village still contains a colliery band and cricket club.The champion snooker player Mr.Joe Davis was born in whitwell as well as Mr.Les Jackson the Derbyshire and England cricketer.
